title: Ticket #2460: RFE: option to disable prepending of paths to executable
description:
Currently the condor_starter, in OsProc::StartJob, will always either prefix the executable with the working directory or iwd: 
Cmd attribute:
exec \ xfer     |     true *   |      false
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
cmd             | $PWD/cmd     | cmd
../cmd          | $PWD/../cmd  | ../cmd
/cmd            | /cmd         | /cmd

Starter execs:
exec \ xfer     |     true *   |      false
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
cmd             | EXECUTE/exec | Iwd/cmd
../cmd          | EXECUTE/exec | Iwd/../cmd
/cmd            | EXECUTE/exec | /cmd

EXECUTE is the EXECUTE param plus /dir_PID

Iwd is the job's Iwd attribute

* must specify when_to_transfer_output and exec must exist

An additional option is desired to allow non-absolute paths to remain unmodified (i.e. let the shell/PATH resolve the final path), when TransferExecutable is false.
remarks:
2011-Sep-15 16:40:45 by eje:
Added new attribute on job ads: PreserveRelativeExecutable, which defaults to False. When set to True (and when TransferExecutable is False), an executable with a relative path name will be left relative, instead of prepending IWD to it.

Here is the new table of behavior for 'starter', when PreserveRelativeExecutable is True. When it is false (the default) the behavior is backward-compatible. 

Starter execs when PreserveRelativeExecutable = True
exec \ xfer     |     true *   |      false
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
cmd             | EXECUTE/exec | cmd
../cmd          | EXECUTE/exec | ../cmd
/cmd            | EXECUTE/exec | /cmd

2011-Sep-15 16:52:07 by eje:
REPRO/TEST:

Requires a user job wrapper to be configured: 

# set path to wherever you put the 'wrap' script
USER_JOB_WRAPPER = /your/path/to/wrap

Here is the wrapper script (which should be named 'wrap' to match above) 

#!/bin/sh

# Run the command and args, as given.
# non-qualified commands will be resolved via PATH env
# e.g. 'sleep' will resolve as /bin/sleep
exec "$@"

The job submission file: 

universe = vanilla
# cmd is relative:
cmd = echo
args = success
iwd = /tmp
transfer_executable = false
run_as_owner = true
getenv = true
output = /tmp/echo.out.$(cluster).$(process)
error = /tmp/echo.err.$(cluster).$(process)
# Enable new feature:
+PreserveRelativeExecutable = True
queue 1

Before fix/rfe: The job submission above will not work correctly. The starter will prepend iwd = "/tmp" to "echo", and you will see this: 

# submit the job
$ condor_submit t.jsub
Submitting job(s).
1 job(s) submitted to cluster 8.

# after job runs, 'out' will be empty, because 'echo' did not run:
$ cat /tmp/echo.out.8.0

# 'err' output shows it could not find bogus "/tmp/echo":
$ more /tmp/echo.err.8.0
/usr/local/src/condor/repro/bz610265-preserve-rel-exe/wrap: line 6: /tmp/echo: No such file or directory
/usr/local/src/condor/repro/bz610265-preserve-rel-exe/wrap: line 6: exec: /tmp/echo: cannot execute: No such file or directory

After the new feature, the job will work as desired: 

$ condor_submit t.jsub
Submitting job(s).
1 job(s) submitted to cluster 1.

# the 'out' file has the expected output from echo: 'success'
$ cat /tmp/echo.out.1.0
success

# the 'err' file is empty:
$ cat /tmp/echo.err.1.0

2011-Oct-12 11:38:35 by jfrey:
I don't like this new feature. Its purpose appears to be to allow the PATH to be searched for the job's executable on the execute machine when not transferring it from the submit machine. But it requires that the execute machine be using a user job wrapper which has a sensible PATH set and which invokes the user job in a way that the PATH is searched. Otherwise, it doesn't appear to work. And the benefit? The user can give their executable as 'echo' instead of '/bin/echo'.

2011-Oct-17 16:29:31 by eje:
The main benefits from requesting customer's POV were
  1. allow their users to say "app" instead of "/some/very/long/path/to/app"
  2. enable users to supply their individual PATH (via getenv = true), which I assume lets them customize and/or alter which "app" gets run from a submit file by altering PATH, as opposed to editing the submit file itself

2011-Oct-19 15:16:28 by jfrey:
You can get these same benefits using the USER_JOB_WRAPPER (which is already required for this new feature to work correctly): 
#!/bin/sh
cmd=$1
shift
if [ ! -x $cmd ] ; then
  cmd=`basename $cmd`
fi
exec $cmd "$@"

2011-Oct-19 15:30:41 by eje:
I agree this RFE is technically redundant since there are existing ways to achieve the same behavior.

Allowing the executable path to be resolved via PATH and "getenv = true" makes things operate more like a traditional shell, where users are accustomed to just invoking a command and letting PATH resolve it. I gather that is why they made this RFE.

2011-Oct-19 16:05:10 by eje:
One issue with using "basename" in the wrapper -- it is less flexible in the sense that it will be applied to user jobs always. Supporting PreserveRelativeExecutable allows other existing behaviors to be invoked or not, as the user prefers.

Matt also pointed out that using "basename" requires the admin to be involved to a greater degree with user submissions.

2011-Oct-19 17:31:16 by jfrey:
The admin is already involved; they have to ensure the USER_JOB_WRAPPER is configured on all machines in a way that that PATH is searched for the executable.

In my proposed alternative, the job wrapper could consult an environment variable to decide whether to use basename, which the user could set in their submit file.

I'd be happier if this attribute caused the starter to perform the equivalent of execvp() when a user job wrapper isn't configured.
